required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Cefepime-AAI101 in the Treatment of Complicated Urinary Tract Infections
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind, Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Cefepime-AAI101 Compared to Piperacillin/Tazobactam in the Treatment of Complicated Urinary Tract Infections, Including Acute Pyelonephritis.

brief_summary.textblock: Multi-center, randomized, double-blind, non-inferiority study of cefepime 2 g/AAI101 500 mg combination compared to piperacillin 4 g/tazobactam 500 mg in a population of adult patients with cUTI or AP. The study will be conducted in approximately 115 sites located in the EU, the US, Central, South America and South Africa.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients in the Microbiological Modified Intent to Treat (m-MITT) Population who achieve overall treatment success at Test Of Cure (TOC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days after EOT [±2 days] for patients receiving 7 days of treatment and 19 days after randomization [±2 days] for patients receiving more than 7 days of treatment.
primary_outcome.description: Treatment success is defined as the composite of clinical outcome of Cure and the microbiological outcome of Eradication (<103 CFU/mL in urine culture).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients in the m-MITT Population with overall treatment success at End of Treatment (EOT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days for patients with cUTI only and up to 14 days for patients cUTI and blood stream infections
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment success is defined as the composite of clinical outcome of Cure and the microbiological outcome of Eradication (<103 CFU/mL in urine culture).

arm_group.description: Cefepime 2 g in combination with AAI101 500 mg q8h (2 hour infusion)
Piperacillin 4 g in combination with Tazobactan 500 mg q8h (2 hour infusion)
